I want to thank you all for the outpouring of support. I am little worse for wear this morning, but on the mend, and so grateful to everyone who has reached out and shared kind words. 

A few reflections I’d like to share this morning:

1. Please get vaccinated and boosted—the respiratory symptoms of COVID are no joke. I am certain my vaccinations did exactly what they were designed to do—which is to help prevent a more severe case. I am indeed grateful🙏.

New Mexico’s Constitution in 1948 disenfranchised Indigenous voters. A proud member of Isleta Pueblo, Miguel refused to accept this injustice. One year later he successfully challenged the constitution to secure the fundamental right to vote for Indigenous voters in New Mexico.

Miguel’s life is a testament to how our veterans continue to serve our communities and uphold the best of our values even after hanging up their uniform. On Veterans Day, we must honor Miguel Trujillo Jr. by carrying his fight for justice forward. #nativeamericanheritagemonth

On this #VeteransDay during Native American Heritage Month, I am honored to highlight the service and activism of one of New Mexico’s veterans, Miguel Trujillo Jr.
